Animals.name: Cow
Animals.description: Cows can sleep while they're standing. Now, that's a skill everyone wants!

Animals.name: Elephant
Animals.description: These massive animals can't jump, nor can they run for very long!

Animals.name: Lion
Animals.description: It's the female lions that hunt for food. Male lions protect their home and cubs.

Animals.name: Rhinoceros
Animals.description: Did you know that a group of rhinos is called a crash? Can you guess why?

Animals.name: Camel
Animals.description: Camels like being friends with other camels and live in large groups!

Animals.name: Kangaroo
Animals.description: Kangaroos are only found in Australia and their babies are called Joeys!

Animals.name: Ape
Animals.description: Gorillas, chimpanzees, orangutans, bonobos, and gibbons are all different types of apes.

Animals.name: Hippopotamus
Animals.description: Hippos only eat plants and like looking for food at night!

Reptiles.name: Snake
Reptiles.description: Snakes don't have eyelids! So, they don't blink and sleep with their eyes open.

Reptiles.name: Lizards
Reptiles.description: Most lizards know how to swim. Some can even run on water!

Reptiles.name: Tortoise
Reptiles.description: Tortoises have very long lives. Some can live upto a 100 years!

Reptiles.name: Crocodile
Reptiles.description: Crocodiles don't sweat. To stay cool, they keep their mouths open.

Reptiles.name: Chameleon
Reptiles.description: The smallest chameleon is almost as big as your eraser.

Reptiles.name: Anaconda
Reptiles.description: Anacondas are the largest snakes in the world! They can grow up to almost 9 meters long!

Reptiles.name: Iguana
Reptiles.description: Iguanas can talk to each other by bobbing their heads! How cool is that!

Reptiles.name: Gecko
Reptiles.description: Geckos come in different sizes, but the smallest one can fit on a dime.

Dinosaurs.name: Tyrannosaurus Rex (T-Rex)
Dinosaurs.description: This dinosaur had the strongest bite of any animal on Earth, ever!

Dinosaurs.name: Velociraptor
Dinosaurs.description: This dinosaur had the biggest brain of all the dinosaurs, literally!

Dinosaurs.name: Stegosaurus
Dinosaurs.description: This dinosaur was given the name Roofed Lizard because of its spiky back!

Dinosaurs.name: Triceratops
Dinosaurs.description: This dinosaur had the biggest head of all land animals!

Dinosaurs.name: Allosaurus
Dinosaurs.description: This dinosaur was given the name Different Lizard because of its funky backbone!

Dinosaurs.name: Ankylosaurus
Dinosaurs.description: This massive dinosaur had very tiny teeth! Isn't that amazing?

Dinosaurs.name: Pterodactyl
Dinosaurs.description: These dinosaurs were the largest flying animals that ever lived.

Dinosaurs.name: Diplodocus
Dinosaurs.description: These were the longest dinosaurs that ever lived. That's longer than four buses in row.

Underwater.name: Seahorse
Underwater.description: Worried about stomach pain? A seahorse doesn't even have one! It eats non-stop to stay alive.

Underwater.name: Shark
Underwater.description: You might trip in darkness but a shark won't! They have excellent night vision.

Underwater.name: Dolphin
Underwater.description: A dolphin lives in water but never drinks any! It gets water from the food it eats.

Underwater.name: Whale
Underwater.description: Whales sing all day long! They hold the record for singing the longest songs on repeat.

Underwater.name: Crab
Underwater.description: Crabs not only walk but also swim sideways! Run forward and it can never catch you!

Underwater.name: Octopus
Underwater.description: We might die if our heart stops but an octopus won't! It lives with three hearts.

Underwater.name: Stingray
Underwater.description: A stingray doesn't have the teeth quite like a shark but they are cousins!

Underwater.name: Turtle
Underwater.description: Turtles have been around for over 200 million years! Let's show them some respect!

Insects.name: Butterfly
Insects.description: Butterflies taste with their feet! Every time they land on a flower, they are tasting it!

Insects.name: Bee
Insects.description: Bees have a strong sense of smell and can see all the colors except red.

Insects.name: Ladybug
Insects.description: Ladybugs are not actually bugs! They are a type of beetle!

Insects.name: Grasshopper
Insects.description: Grasshoppers have been on earth for a long time! They were here even before the dinosaurs!

Insects.name: Firefly
Insects.description: If you catch a firefly in a jar, be sure to let it go after a day, or it will die!

Insects.name: Caterpillar
Insects.description: A caterpillar is what turns into a big beautiful butterfly!

Insects.name: Mantis
Insects.description: A mantis has two eyes, that too at the bottom of their belly!

Insects.name: Beetle
Insects.description: Beetles can camp in hot deserts as well as the polar regions! Talk about being adaptable!

Space.name: Spaceship
Space.description: There are actual spaceships used by humans! These are called space shuttles!

Space.name: An Alien
Space.description: An alien is a creature from another planet! We don't really know if they exist!

Space.name: The Sun
Space.description: The sun is actually a star! And it is the closest star to our planet, Earth!

Space.name: The Moon
Space.description: The moon has no light of its own. It shines because of the sun's light!

Space.name: Shooting Stars
Space.description: Shooting stars are not actually stars! They are rocks from outer space!

Space.name: Satellite
Space.description: Satellites are like robot spies. They are sent to outer space to collect information!

Space.name: Unknown Flying Object (UFO)
Space.description: UFOs are things in the sky that cannot be explained by the people who see them!

Space.name: Telescope
Space.description: A telescope lets us see things that are very very far! Like the moon!

Vehicles.name: Helicopter
Vehicles.description: This aircraft can take off and land straight-up. It can move in all directions.

Vehicles.name: Ship
Vehicles.description: You thought you swim well? This watercraft can float on oceans and deep waters.

Vehicles.name: Airplane
Vehicles.description: An airplane can fly and helps us get from one city to the other. It is heavier than air.

Vehicles.name: Submarine
Vehicles.description: This watercraft can stay in deep waters for months. It is also used in wars.

Vehicles.name: Taxi
Vehicles.description: It is a car with a driver that can take you to a place of your choice.

Vehicles.name: Hot Air Balloon
Vehicles.description: This fun aircraft is lighter than air. The bag inside it is called an envelope.

Vehicles.name: Tractor
Vehicles.description: You find this on a farm. The fastest tractor can travel at a speed of more than 60 mph.

Vehicles.name: Truck
Vehicles.description: If all the U.S. trucks were arranged in a line, they will end at the Moon.

Flowers.name: Sunflower
Flowers.description: Each sunflower contains thousands of tiny sunflowers.

Flowers.name: Rose
Flowers.description: The oldest rose alive is 1,000 years old and lives in Germany.

Flowers.name: Marigold
Flowers.description: You can munch on a tasty marigold in your salad and dessert.

Flowers.name: Lotus
Flowers.description: It keeps the lake water cool and saves fish from direct sunlight too.

Flowers.name: Lily
Flowers.description: Lilies love to have a social life. They grow together in groups of three to five.

Flowers.name: Jasmine
Flowers.description: This special flower lets its fragrance out at night after the sun sets.

Flowers.name: Tulip
Flowers.description: You can munch on a tulip! It is edible and used for making wine.

Flowers.name: Daisy
Flowers.description: Daisies are more than 4,000 years old. Their stalks are longer than their leaves.

Vegetables.name: Mushroom
Vegetables.description: These umbrella-like things are not the whole plant. Most of it actually grows underground!

Vegetables.name: Pumpkin
Vegetables.description: We can eat every part of a pumpkin plant, even its seeds and stem!

Vegetables.name: Bell Pepper
Vegetables.description: All three types of bell peppers start as green and turn yellow and then red as they ripen!

Vegetables.name: Cucumber
Vegetables.description: Raw cucumbers are mostly just water! So grab one next time you feel thirsty!

Vegetables.name: Onion
Vegetables.description: The part of the onion we usually eat actually grows underground!

Vegetables.name: Broccoli
Vegetables.description: The heaviest broccoli in the world weighed 35 pounds! That's almost as heavy as you!

Vegetables.name: Peas
Vegetables.description: Peas are mostly green. But there are also peas that can be yellow or purple!

Vegetables.name: Turnip
Vegetables.description: Turnips were the original jack-o'-lantern, like the pumpkins you carve on halloween!

Fruits.name: Strawberry
Fruits.description: It is the only fruit that grows around 200 seeds on the outside.

Fruits.name: Banana
Fruits.description: While a single banana is called a finger, a bunch of bananas is called a hand!

Fruits.name: Cherries
Fruits.description: All cherries growing on a single tree can be picked within seven seconds!

Fruits.name: Orange
Fruits.description: All oranges are not orange in color. Some of them may be green too!

Fruits.name: Pineapple
Fruits.description: A pineapple plant can bear only one fruit at a time.

Fruits.name: Pear
Fruits.description: Pears grow on trees but they ripen best only when they are taken off of them.

Fruits.name: Kiwi
Fruits.description: It shares its looks and name with the furry brown National bird of New Zealand.

Fruits.name: Lemon
Fruits.description: A lemon starts off as a small flower with a light fragrance before it turns into a fruit.

Food Items.name: Burger
Food Items.description: The first ever burger was sold for just 5 cents in 1921.

Food Items.name: Pizza
Food Items.description: Almost 350 slices of pizza are eaten in the U.S. every second.

Food Items.name: Ice cream
Food Items.description: An ice cream can give you a brain freeze when the roof of your mouth turns too cold!

Food Items.name: Hot Dog
Food Items.description: It has been to space! Astronauts on the Apollo 7 mission loved to munch on it.

Food Items.name: Cupcake
Food Items.description: It is known as 'Fairy cake' in Britain and 'Patty cake' in Australia.

Food Items.name: Donut
Food Items.description: It was the favorite late night snack of the U.S. police officers in the 1950s.

Food Items.name: Cheese
Food Items.description: Do you like cheese? It was discovered by mistake by someone around 7000 years ago.

Food Items.name: Sushi
Food Items.description: You thought it was all about a fish but it's named after vinegar flavored rice!

Celebrations.name: Christmas
Celebrations.description: Rudolph is just one of the nine reindeers that pull Santa's sleigh!

Celebrations.name: Easter
Celebrations.description: We consume the second highest number of Easter candies on this holiday.

Celebrations.name: Halloween
Celebrations.description: Long ago, people wore masks and costumes not for fun but to scare away ghosts!

Celebrations.name: Birthday
Celebrations.description: The ancient Greeks made the first ever birthday cake to make their gods happy!

Celebrations.name: 4th of July
Celebrations.description: Over one hundred and fifty million hot dogs are consumed all across America today!

Celebrations.name: St. Patrick's Day
Celebrations.description: Chicago celebrated this holiday by literally coloring their river green in 1962.

Celebrations.name: summer holiday
Celebrations.description: Who doesn't love the summer holidays? It's a time to have fun and go on long vacations.

Celebrations.name: Snow Day
Celebrations.description: Ever tried catching a snowflake? You will never find two that look exactly the same!

Places.name: School
Places.description: Want to learn, play, and make new friends? A school is the best place to do so.

Places.name: Bank
Places.description: When we want to save or borrow money, where should we go? To a bank, of course!

Places.name: Hospital
Places.description: Hurt or feeling sick? Rush to a hospital! A doctor or nurse will take care of you.

Places.name: Church
Places.description: Christians go to Church. It's a building with the symbol of a cross.

Places.name: Bakery
Places.description: Want some delicious bread, cakes, or cookies? Head to a bakery (now)!

Places.name: Pharmacy
Places.description: After seeing a doctor, we go to a pharmacy to get the medicines to make us feel better.

Places.name: Post office
Places.description: When we want to send letters or postcards we drop by a post office.

Places.name: Barber Shop
Places.description: Fancy a haircut? Time to head to a barber shop to get your hair done.

Scenery.name: Rainy Day
Scenery.description: On a rainy day, don't forget to wear gumboots, raincoats, and carry colorful umbrellas.

Scenery.name: Autumn/ Fall
Scenery.description: Leaves change color and fall off the trees in the autumn.

Scenery.name: Spring
Scenery.description: During spring, the weather is generally warm and sunny and flowers begin to bloom!

Scenery.name: Winter
Scenery.description: Wintertime is the coldest time of the year! It's the perfect time to build a snowman.

Scenery.name: Summer
Scenery.description: Summer is the year's hottest season! It's clearly the best time for having ice pops.

Scenery.name: Beach
Scenery.description: It's a great spot for surfing or simply lying in the sun.

Scenery.name: Circus
Scenery.description: If you enjoy watching clowns and juggling acts, head to a circus!

Scenery.name: Jungle
Scenery.description: Jungles cover only 6% of the Earth's surface, but they are home to half of all species!

Famous Monuments.name: Statue of Liberty
Famous Monuments.description: Located in the New York City, this large statue represents the Roman goddess Libertas.

Famous Monuments.name: Liberty Bell
Famous Monuments.description: This monument is located in Philadelphia. It is a famous symbol of American independence.

Famous Monuments.name: Mount Rushmore
Famous Monuments.description: It is located in the Black Hills in Keystone and is carved into the side of a mountain.

Famous Monuments.name: Eiffel Tower
Famous Monuments.description: Designed by Alexandre-Gustave Eiffel, the Eiffel Tower is the tallest structure in Paris.

Famous Monuments.name: Colosseum
Famous Monuments.description: The Colosseum is an oval-shaped open stadium in Rome. It was built a long long time ago!

Famous Monuments.name: London Bridge
Famous Monuments.description: The London Bridge is one of the oldest known bridges across the river Thames in London.

Famous Monuments.name: Taj Mahal
Famous Monuments.description: The Taj Mahal, located in Agra, was built to honor the favorite wife of Shah Jahan.

Famous Monuments.name: The Great Pyramid of Giza
Famous Monuments.description: The pyramids of Giza in Egypt have shrunk! They are now 455 feet tall.

Professions.name: Doctor
Professions.description: A doctor is someone who treats illnesses and injuries.

Professions.name: Astronaut
Professions.description: An astronaut is a person who travels into outer space.

Professions.name: Firefighter
Professions.description: A firefighter is someone who puts out fires and rescues people.

Professions.name: Chef
Professions.description: A chef is someone who cooks food for a living and manages a kitchen staff.

Professions.name: Teacher
Professions.description: A teacher is someone whose job is to teach and help others gain knowledge.

Professions.name: Police Officer
Professions.description: Police officers are those that work for the police. They solve crimes and protect us.

Professions.name: Mailman
Professions.description: A mailman's job is to collect and deliver letters and packages.

Professions.name: Farmer
Professions.description: A farmer is a person who owns and works on a farm.

Birds.name: Rooster
Birds.description: A rooster protects his flock and warns other birds if he sees danger. Super protective!

Birds.name: Flamingo
Birds.description: Flamingos eat upside-down. Their curved bill helps to filter food from mud and water.

Birds.name: Parrot
Birds.description: Parrots are intelligent birds. They can copy different sounds, including yours!

Birds.name: Peacock
Birds.description: The head of a peacock is covered with feathers, giving it a crown-like look.

Birds.name: Owl
Birds.description: There are about 200 species of owls in the world, with the Elf owl being the tiniest.

Birds.name: Cockatiel
Birds.description: Cockatiel, commonly known as weiro bird or quarrion, is a little parrot.

Birds.name: Hummingbird
Birds.description: Hummingbirds are the smallest of all living birds. They can even fly backwards!

Birds.name: Blue Jay
Birds.description: Blue Jays can copy the sound of hawks. You heard that right!

Kitchen.name: Plate
Kitchen.description: Food is served to us on a plate. There are many kinds and shapes. Do you have a favorite one?

Kitchen.name: Fork
Kitchen.description: Spain and Italy were the first countries to use forks for eating.

Kitchen.name: Spoon
Kitchen.description: We use spoons to eat food. They were used in the past to show status and power.

Kitchen.name: Knife
Kitchen.description: The knife is without a doubt the earliest eating tool ever made!

Kitchen.name: Glass
Kitchen.description: Glass can be recycled endlessly without losing its quality.

Kitchen.name: Water Bottle
Kitchen.description: Making a plastic bottle uses twice as much water as fits inside the bottle!

Kitchen.name: Kettle
Kitchen.description: The first electric kettle was invented in the United States in 1891.

Kitchen.name: Toaster
Kitchen.description: El Tosto or Eclipse Toaster was the name given to the first toaster.

Household Items.name: Book
Household Items.description: The term bibliosma refers to the love for the smell of books. Don't new books smell amazing?!

Household Items.name: Umbrella
Household Items.description: The first waterproof umbrellas were made more than 3000 years ago in ancient China.

Household Items.name: Ball
Household Items.description: A baseball is a ball used in the sport of the same name, baseball.

Household Items.name: Balloon
Household Items.description: Do you know  the sport or pastime of flying in a balloon is called ballooning?

Household Items.name: Chair
Household Items.description: Before chairs were invented, people used to sit on stools or stones. Yikes!

Household Items.name: Lamp
Household Items.description: Do you know that before electric lamps were invented, oil lamps or candles were used?

Household Items.name: Pencil
Household Items.description: Enjoy writing with pencils? A pencil can write under water, upside down, and in space.

Household Items.name: Keys
Household Items.description: The first key was discovered 6000 years ago, about the same time as locks.

Musical Instruments.name: Guitar
Musical Instruments.description: The world's biggest guitar is 43 feet long! That is longer than your school bus!

Musical Instruments.name: Violin
Musical Instruments.description: The violin has a nickname! It is also called a fiddle!

Musical Instruments.name: Drums
Musical Instruments.description: Did you know that drums were used for communicating over long distances?!

Musical Instruments.name: Piano
Musical Instruments.description: The piano, as we know it, was invented more than 300 years ago!

Musical Instruments.name: Flute
Musical Instruments.description: Flutes have been around for a long while, and they can be made with wood or metal!

Musical Instruments.name: Maracas
Musical Instruments.description: Maracas are also called rumba-shakers and chac-chacs because of the sound they make!

Musical Instruments.name: Xylophone
Musical Instruments.description: That's not an X! Xylophone is pronounced with a Z sound, like this: zai-luh-fone!

Musical Instruments.name: Trumpet
Musical Instruments.description: Trumpets can get very very loud. Sometimes they can be even louder than a jet plane!
